meta.content: The Federal Identity Program (FIP) Manual establishes the Government of Canada’s corporate identity standards. The standards and guidelines used in conjunction with the FIP policy ensure institutions are consistently identified and clearly recognizable to the public across a wide range of corporate identity applications.

div.div: The Federal Identity Program (FIP) Manual establishes the Government of Canada’s corporate identity standards. of","name":"mobile application gallery","nameTranslation":"répertoire d\u0027applications mobiles"},{"id":11699,"definition":"\u003cp\u003eThe planned, one-way systematic collection, by or for the It involves activities such as the design and testing of collection methods and instruments, data collection, data entry, data coding, and primary data analysis.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe following are not considered public opinion research for the purposes of the Policy on Communications and Federal Identity and its supporting instruments:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eConsultations or engagement activities;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eProgram evaluation projects included in the Departmental Evaluation Plan;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eUsability testing;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eBehavioural or factual research;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLiterature reviews or reviews of secondary sources;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eSecondary data analysis;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eFactual verification of performance of services or delivery of goods in contract situations;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eEmployee exit interviews;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003e360-degree employee-manager reviews; and\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAssessment of training or information sessions, either in person or online.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"public opinion research","nameTranslation":"recherche sur l\u0027opinion publique"},{"id":11677,"definition":"Activities related to producing and placing advertising, including campaign planning, creative development, pretesting, production, media planning, placement of advertising and evaluation.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"advertising activities","nameTranslation":"activités de publicité"},{"id":11683,"definition":"Any product produced by or on behalf of the Government of Canada that informs the public about policies, programs, services and initiatives, as well as dangers or risks to health, safety or the environment. Communications products can be developed for a variety of media, including print, electronic and recording.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"communications product","nameTranslation":"produit de communication"},{"id":11689,"definition":"The senior executive who is responsible for the management of the department\u0027s corporate identity and communications products and activities.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"head of communications","nameTranslation":"chef des communications"},{"id":11691,"definition":"The purchase of advertising time or space, e.g., for television, radio, newspapers, magazines, websites, cinemas or out-of-home media.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"media buy or placement","nameTranslation":"achat ou placement dans les médias"},{"id":11673,"definition":"Writing that is easily understandable on first reading. Communicating in plain language may involve writing to a specific level of literacy or education.","instrumentId":30683,"instrumentTitle":"Communications and Federal Identity, Policy on","name":"plain language writing","nameTranslation":"rédaction en langage clair et simple"},{"id":11681,"definition":"See ADV number.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"authorization number","nameTranslation":"numéro d\u0027autorisation"},{"id":11688,"definition":"The range of items, intended for internal and external use, that bear the Government of Canada signature or departmental signature and the Canada wordmark, including but not limited to stationery, forms, signage, websites and other electronic communications, communications products, personnel identification and motor vehicles.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"field of application","nameTranslation":"domaine d\u0027application"},{"id":11667,"definition":"The combination of the department\u0027s approved English and French applied title and the flag symbol or the arms of Canada.","instrumentId":30683,"instrumentTitle":"Communications and Federal Identity, Policy on","name":"corporate signature","nameTranslation":"signature visuelle"},{"id":11685,"definition":"The unified manner in which an organization, company or public sector entity identifies its presence and activities. A corporate identity can include elements such as nomenclature, symbols, colour, typography and standards for graphics. The Government of Canada\u0027s corporate identity is prescribed by the Federal Identity Program.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"corporate identity","nameTranslation":"image de marque"},{"id":11695,"definition":"Printing communications products, whether using in-house printers or contracted printing firms, when requested by an individual or as the need arises. On-demand printing does not require warehousing.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"on-demand printing","nameTranslation":"impression sur demande"},{"id":11705,"definition":"A contractual document, issued by the Communication Procurement Directorate of Public Services and Procurement Canada that instructs the agency of record to purchase advertising media space, time or both from media suppliers.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"work authorization","nameTranslation":"autorisation de travail"},{"id":11698,"definition":"See consultations","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"public engagement","nameTranslation":"activités de mobilisation du public"},{"id":11680,"definition":"A private sector supplier, selected through a competitive process and under contract with the Government of Canada, that negotiates, consolidates, purchases and verifies advertising media time and space for the Government of Canada.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"agency of record","nameTranslation":"agence de coordination"},{"id":11682,"definition":"The global identifier of the Government of Canada, which is composed of a graphically modified typeface and the flag symbol.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"Canada wordmark","nameTranslation":"mot-symbole « Canada »"},{"id":11703,"definition":"\u003cp\u003eA predetermined number of printed communications products, including publications, that require warehousing. Departments undertake volume printing only in the following situations:\u003c/p\u003e\u003col class=\"lst-lwr-alph\"\u003e\u003cli\u003eA printed version is specifically required under legislation, regulations or parliamentary procedures;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe product informs the public about key information related to health, safety or security issues;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eA printed version is required to meet the specific needs of the target audience;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe size or format of the product does not allow for printing using commonly available printers;\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eAn existing contract for printing, warehousing or distribution services, put in place prior to the \u003ca href=\"/pol/doc-eng.aspx?id=27167\"\u003eProcedures for Publishing\u003c/a\u003e taking effect, cannot be cancelled, or the cost of cancelling the contract exceeds the benefits; or\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eThe minister or the person designated in Schedule VI (Part III, Column II) of the Financial Administration Act requests the printing.\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ol\u003e","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"volume printing","nameTranslation":"impression de masse"},{"id":11664,"definition":"Formally known as the Arms of Her Majesty The Queen in Right of Canada or the Arms of His/Her Majesty in Right of Canada, and also referred to as the Canadian coat of arms and the royal arms of Canada. The arms of Canada is an official symbol of the Government of Canada. A stylized one-colour rendering of the arms of Canada is used to identify departments whose heads report directly to Parliament, institutions that have a quasi-judicial function, ambassadors, heads of consulates or missions, and the Clerk of the Privy Council.","instrumentId":30683,"instrumentTitle":"Communications and Federal Identity, Policy on","name":"arms of Canada","nameTranslation":"armoiries du Canada"},{"id":11663,"definition":"The official name of a department that is used in communications with the public and in its corporate signature.","instrumentId":30683,"instrumentTitle":"Communications and Federal Identity, Policy on","name":"applied title","nameTranslation":"titre d\u0027usage"},{"id":11684,"definition":"A two-way process that seeks direct participation from the public or specific stakeholders on a range of issues to inform government decisions about policies, programs, services, and legislative and regulatory initiatives, whether in person or online.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"consultations","nameTranslation":"activités de consultation"},{"id":11704,"definition":"The user-centric, mobile-optimized website that organizes Government of Canada content by themes. The flag symbol is protected under the laws of Canada, and internationally under the Paris Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property.","instrumentId":30683,"instrumentTitle":"Communications and Federal Identity, Policy on","name":"flag symbol","nameTranslation":"symbole du drapeau"},{"id":11679,"definition":"A media placement authorization number issued by the Advertising Coordination and Partnerships Directorate of Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) to a department as confirmation that its advertising creative and media plan comply with government legislation, policies and standards. The ADV number is also referred to as an authorization number.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"ADV number","nameTranslation":"numéro PUB"},{"id":11697,"definition":"All audiences, including employees of the Government of Canada and Canadians living or travelling abroad, who require information about Government of Canada decisions, policies, programs and services.","instrumentId":30682,"instrumentTitle":"Communications, Directive on the Management of","name":"public","nameTranslation":"public"},{"id":11670,"definition":"A graphic mark, emblem or symbol adopted by an individual or organization to aid or promote recognition. Logos can be purely graphic or can feature the name of the organization in a special typeface (e.g., logotype).","instrumentId":30683,"instrumentTitle":"Communications and Federal Identity, Policy on","name":"logo","nameTranslation":"logo"}]
